channel.title: Reading Stuff
channel.description: Interesting stuff to read (okay and sometimes also to watch or listen ;-) found on the Internet.

item.title: DevOps: Don't destroy silos, transform them
item.description: "Destroying silos" is a clumsy solution to team isolation.

item.title: The Absolute Minimum Every Software Developer Must Know About Unicode in 2023 (Still No Excuses!)
item.description: Twenty years after Joel Spolsky's article a lot changed but UTF still has it's surprises.

item.title: Why are process gates the hellish spawn of evil you should avoid at all cost?
item.description: A common leadership mistake is process gates. What are process gates?

item.title: (Almost) Every infrastructure decision I endorse or regret after 4 years running infrastructure at a startup
item.description: This post lists some of the major decisions made.

item.title: Leadership Language Lessons from Star Trek
item.description: Picard didn't order people about. He didn't assume he knew best. He wasn't seeking glory. In his words: The Enterprise was a vehicle for his crew to better themselves and society. What a brilliant metaphor for organisations to aspire to.

item.title: Engineering’s role in Mergers & Acquisitions.
item.description: I managed the engineering team at Digg as we ran out of money, and were eventually acquired. It was an eye opening experience, and I learned a great deal about the reality and the optics of selling a company, particularly one with no money and a shrinking user base. Humbling was just the beginning. Since then, I’ve had the opportunity to evaluate a number of companies from the other side of the Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) table.

item.title: After 14 years in the industry, I still find programming difficult
My Notes on GitLab Postgres Schema Design
item.description: Notes on GitLab Postgres Schema Design.
